questions.text: What is the largest organ in the human body?
questions.explanation: The skin is the body's largest organ, protecting it from external elements.

questions.text: How many bones are in the adult human body?
questions.explanation: Babies are born with more bones (around 270), but they fuse together to form 206 in adulthood.

questions.text: Which blood type is known as the universal donor?
questions.explanation: O Negative blood can be used in transfusions for any blood type.

questions.text: What is the main function of red blood cells?
questions.explanation: Red blood cells contain hemoglobin which transports oxygen from the lungs to the rest of the body.
The pancreas produces insulin, which regulates blood sugar levels.

questions.text: What is the smallest bone in the human body?
questions.explanation: The stapes is located in the middle ear and is approximately 3mm x 2.5mm.

questions.text: Which part of the brain controls balance and coordination?
questions.explanation: The cerebellum (Latin for 'little brain') plays a key role in motor control.

questions.text: What is the hardest substance in the human body?
questions.explanation: Tooth enamel is the hardest and most highly mineralized substance in your body.

questions.text: How many chambers does the human heart have?
questions.explanation: The heart has four chambers: two atria and two ventricles.
The femur is the thigh bone and the longest, strongest bone in the body.
DNA carries genetic instructions for development and function.

questions.text: Which organ filters blood to produce urine?
questions.explanation: The kidneys filter waste products from the blood.

questions.text: What is the colored part of the eye called?
questions.explanation: The iris is the colored ring of muscle that controls the size of the pupil.

questions.text: Which vitamin is produced by the body when exposed to sunlight?
questions.explanation: Vitamin D is synthesized in the skin upon exposure to UVB radiation.
Tendons connect muscle to bone, while ligaments connect bone to bone.
